data.title: Simon Carlyle, creator of Two Doors Down, dies aged 48
data.meta_description: Simon Carlyle, who created the BBC sitcom Two Doors Down, has been described as “a wonderful person and a major comedic talent” after his death at the age of 4
data.text:
Simon Carlyle, who created the BBC sitcom Two Doors Down, has been described as “a wonderful person and a major comedic talent” after his death at the age of 48.

The Scottish sitcom starred Arabella Weir, Kieran Hodgson, Alex Norton, Doon Mackichan, Jonathan Watson and was co-created and written by Gregor Sharp. It is set among the residents of Latimer Crescent and was commissioned for a seventh series in February and is set to move to BBC1.

In a statement Amanda Davis, Carlyle’s manager, said: “I am immensely sorry to confirm that Simon Carlyle has died at the age of 48,” She gave no details about his death, but added: “Simon was a wonderful person and a major comedic talent.

“He was much respected
